title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Bruins' Fraser Minten scored a critical goal against Toronto Maple Leafs, marking Boston's sixth consecutive win.
Minten was traded to the Bruins last season in a deal involving Brandon Carlo and had his family in attendance.
Coach Marco Sturm praised Minten as the "best player on the ice" after his impactful performance against his former team.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in Toronto, receiving his ring and plaque on Saturday.
Chara shared the honor with fellow Bruin Joe Thornton, both named to the 2025 Hall of Fame class.
Chara's career highlights include a Stanley Cup win, a Norris Trophy, and serving as Bruins captain for 14 years.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox are positioned to pursue top free agents with $25M below first luxury tax threshold.
Boston favored to re-sign Alex Bregman; predictions vary on signing Kyle Schwarber and Pete Alonso.
Red Sox among best fits for Japanese free agent Munetaka Murakami and pitchers Dylan Cease, Framber Valdez.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway, highlighting tracks from his debut album 'Get Lifted'.
The concert included various covers and a medley of songs from artists like Kanye West, Alicia Keys, and Jay-Z.
Legend showcased his musical versatility with a setlist mixing R&B, gospel, and pop influences over two hours.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, echoing comments from a previous game.
In Monday's loss to the Jazz, Brown expressed frustration over a missed foul call during a critical game moment.
Despite Brown's comments, he was not fined for his remarks following the controversial officiating in the Celtics' losses.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Buccaneers have a 6-2 record, with losses to the Eagles and Lions, as they prepare to face the Patriots.
Quarterback Baker Mayfield ranks among the NFL's top deep passers, with eight touchdowns on long-distance throws this season.
Key Bucs receivers Mike Evans and Chris Godwin are out with injuries, while the defense boasts top performers like Jamel Dean.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS, marking their first Patriots game in over two years.
Nantz and Romo last called a Patriots game in 2023, when the Patriots lost 21-17 to the Raiders, falling to a 1-5 record.
Nantz expressed excitement about calling a game for Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, whom he's known since before the draft.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Orlando Magic defeated the Boston Celtics 123-110, delivering the Celtics' first defeat in the NBA Cup.
Jaylen Brown scored 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting but struggled from three-point range, going 1-for-6.
The Celtics' defense faltered, allowing the Magic to make 17 three-pointers and score 38 points in the fourth quarter.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph faces a public reprimand for creating an 'appearance of impropriety' during a 2018 ICE-related case.
A hearing officer found no evidence Joseph authorized a migrant's escape from ICE, but noted an inadvertent violation of court rules.
Joseph, federally charged in 2019, was cleared of misconduct, and prosecutors dropped charges in 2022 in exchange for a state investigation.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox lost to Yankees 2-1 in AL Wild Card Series, ending their postseason run in October.
Shortstop Trevor Story opted into his contract, while third baseman Alex Bregman opted out.
Manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future, citing postseason experience gained by players.
